docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: He is swaddled in down and curled up inside his tent, talking in a muffled voice, straining to find the words that will explain to a stranger wht happened to him in Vietman. He isn't very good at it at first. His account is formal, official: ''From February to November 1966, I served with Charlie Company, Second 503d Airborne Infantry, the 173d Airborne Brigade.

byline.original: By Kim Heron; Kim Heron is an editor of this magazine

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: LINKS between compounds in the food people eat and the levels of certain chemicals in their brains are leading some psychiatric researchers to suggest that nutritional supplements might be used as psychiatric drugs.

headline.main: Food and Brain: Psychiatrists Explore Use of Nutrients in Treating Disorders

docs.snippet: LEAD: LINKS between compounds in the food people eat and the levels of certain chemicals in their brains are leading some psychiatric researchers to suggest that nutritional supplements might be used as psychiatric drugs.
